definition: disco dancing/to dance at a disco

sentences.english: Terrific. You can show me how to dance.
sentences.chinese: 太棒了，你可以向我展示一怎樣蹦迪。

sentences.english: The wife and that Beijing girls jumped enlighten, was called a bottle of American agave liquor.
sentences.chinese: 老婆和那個北京女孩蹦迪去了，就叫上一瓶龍舌蘭酒。

sentences.english: Great. You know, I'm an ace of disco.
sentences.chinese: 好啊，要知道，我可是個蹦迪高手。

sentences.english: On weekends, many people go to dance at the discos. Most are young people.
sentences.chinese: 週末去蹦迪的人真不少，多數是年輕人。

sentences.english: John: Let's go to a disco.
sentences.chinese: 那我們去迪斯科舞廳蹦迪吧。

sentences.english: Their national distraction is going to the disco.
sentences.chinese: 他們的全民消遣就是去蹦迪。

definition: to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
(loanword) party (social gathering)/(Tw) party (typically associated with sex and drugs)
disco/night club/abbr. for 迪斯科廳|迪斯科厅
(slang) to battle each other in street dancing (derived from Taiwanese 較, which sounds similar to Mandarin 尬[ga4])/(slang) to perform weird dance moves
to eat and drink gluttonously/to pig out
